results.title: Blackmagic Design Media Preservation Lab
results.brief_description: The Media Preservation Lab is a purposed built public facing lab.
results.description: There are about 250,000 artefacts in the ACMI Collection. We’ve been collecting film, videogames, artworks, home movies, stills and press kits – as well as a huge range of other paraphernalia – for over 75 years, ever since ACMI was conceived as a film lending and education organisation known as the State Film Centre. Inside the Blackmagic Media Preservation Lab, our staff and collaborators are digitising our film and time-based media collections, assessing physical artefacts from our videogame collection and film donations, as well as conducting hours of quality assessment work on our born-digital works to make the collection accessible onsite and online.
description_for_label: There are about 250,000 artefacts in the ACMI Collection, which we’ve been collecting for over 75 years – ever since ACMI was conceived as a film lending and education organisation called the State Film Centre. In the Blackmagic Media Preservation Lab, we’re digitising our film and time-based media collections, assessing physical artefacts from our videogame collection and film donations, as well as making the collection accessible onsite and online.

results.title: Media matters: an easy guide to getting media coverage
results.brief_description: Media Matters gives you the who, when, where and how of getting the media interested in your story and then tells you how to follow through. It also tells you how the media works. The kit comprises a video and comprehensive written guide covering ideas on how to package a story and make it interesting to the media and the audience. It is designed for individuals and voluntary groups involved in promoting fitness and healthy lifestyles in the community and can be used to publicise activities and attract membership. The video contains case studies of groups that have succeeded in getting coverage and interviews with working journalists.

results.title: Media law
results.creator_credit: Annenberg, CPB Project and Bennet Berkov
results.brief_description: Focuses on reporters’ rights and defemses for potential libel or invasion of privacy lawsuits as well as concepts like open meeting, shield and freedom of information laws. Discusses legal issues that may confront students working for a school newspaper or other publication.

results.title: Media Ecology ads
results.brief_description:
Muntadas, since the 1970s, has been preoccupied with the translation of information. In this series of three short films; Fuse, Timer and Slow Down, the artist focuses on the immediacy of the subjects
chosen for each film (a burning fuse, an hourglass, a running tap). An exploration of temporality and semiotics.

results.title: Media analysis
results.brief_description: The program looks at how to approach an analysis of written and televised media. it looks at the purpose and audience of different types of media, the way journalists use their style to create moods and the impact that the style has on the reader. Footage from news broadcasts is also shown.

results.title: Medecin Malgre Lui
results.brief_description:
Argan, a hypochondriac who coughs constantly to impress upon his family and physicians the gravity of his condition. So concerned is Argan for his health that he resolves his daughter must marry a medical student, thereby ensuring he has a doctor near him at all times.

Credits: Director, Francois Gir ; photography, Robert Juillard ; music, Dominique Paladilhe.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Darras, Rosy Varte, Claude Nicot, G. Audoubert, Herve Sand, Dora Doll, Giani Esposito.

results.title: Medea
results.creator_credit: San Marco, Number One, Janus, Franco Rossellini, Marina Cicogna and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: A mythical tale of love, betrayal and revenge, “Medea” is a fascinating collision of Freudian and Marxist themes from Italy’s most controversial director. Adapted from the Euripidean drama, Pasolini’s disturbing vision of personal and national conflict stars operatic legend Maria Callas in the title role, offering an extraordinary performance as the high priestess, Medea, whose love is threatened by corrupt political ambition. A vivid and aesthetically challenging vision, “Medea” is a complex blend of classical mythology and contemporary social criticism.

results.title: Medbourne Primary School
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center and Henry Felt
results.brief_description: Focuses mainly on the seven to eleven year-olds and the teachers in a rural school in which the total enrolment is forty-eight. Shot over a period of five days, the film shows the continual activity. Some children are painting, others are using their printing press, while others are cooking a chicken outside.
